description: Numbers for which the number of distinct base 10 digits is 4.
comments: Last week's challenge on National Public Radio from listener Henry Hook of Brooklyn, N.Y.: In a few weeks something will happen that hasn't happened since 1987. What is it? Answer: A year with no repeat digits (1987, 2013). [Jonathan Vos Post, Dec 02 2012]The subset of primes begins: 1039, 1049, 1063, 1069, 1087, 1093, 1097.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4536 (complete)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
